intro: Lippia ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty lippia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, hairy leaves and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties. The flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
